channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trash left on street, 23rd January
item.description:
Food and domestic waste left on street for a couple of days now. Usual spot

item.title: Disassembled furniture on the pavement, 23rd January
item.description:
Disassembled furniture next to number 13 Cranmore road is falling onto the pavement for the last three or more months. It rots in the rain and causes tripping hazard on a narrow pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cranmore Road, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead Fox in our driveway, 23rd January
item.description:
It seems a Fox was run over last night and someone place the dead Fox on the pavement and our driveway at 199a Worsley Bridge Road, BR3 1 RW Could you kindly collect it please. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hackington Crescent, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste - Leesons Way/Petersham Gardens, 23rd January
item.description:
A pile of waste has been left alongside Leesons Way at the end of Petersham Gardens. Please could this be removed?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Petersham Gardens, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter around the planters on Tabard Street, 23rd January
item.description:
There is a bag rubbish bag, food packaging, plastic bottle and plastic bags dumped in and around the planters on Tabard Street. It has been there for three days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tabard Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Butcher leaves black bags here, 23rd January
item.description:
Since the butcher shop opened there have been constant t black bags here which encourages others to dump and block the pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shorncliffe Road, Old Kent Road, Greater London

item.title: Damaged wooden barrier, 23rd January

item.title: Road breaking up, 23rd January
item.description:
Franklin Road, close to junction with Croydon Road. Road surface is cracking and breaking up. Please repair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Franklin Road, Penge, Greater London

item.title: Baldwins farm, 23rd January
item.description:
There is a landfill site at balwins farm the lorry’s leaving have no wheel wash mud everywhere very dangerous the road sweeping lorry is useless there will be an accident its like a skating ring
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dennises Lane, Corbets Tey, Greater London

item.title: Flytipping on property, 23rd January
item.description:
Dismantled furniture and a table has been dumped in the front garden and along the side alley of the property. As owners of the property we did not put the furniture there

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surlingham Close, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction of Park Rd and Etheldene Rd drain whole severely damaged again, 23rd January
item.description:
Junction of Park Rd and Etheldene Rd the main double drain hole has worn again, noticed it last week. It is VERY DANGEROUS as traffic is swerving to avoid the sharp drop. Buses and cars are being damaged if they cannot avoid it at the busy junction on the filter light.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Etheldene Avenue, Muswell Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter bin not collected for days, rubbish everywhere, 23rd January
item.description:
The litter by the bus stop hadn’t been collected for days. Full to the brim. Everyone throwing their rubbish around it now. Looks disgusting and not hygienic. Please could u send someone to clear it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mitchell Way, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Full bins, 23rd January
item.description:
LBB bin have not been emptied this week with litter all over the floor & area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Road, Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Near to the oak tree & silver birch, 23rd January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lodge Road, Sundridge, Greater London

item.title: The problem reported has not been dealt with. This rubbish that covers an area of 15 x 4 x 4m in height is a serious health and safety risk and is right next to a playground. Do we want our children to play next to a fly tip and believe rubbish is acceptable?, 23rd January
item.description:
